page.title: 02Kettlethorpe/Fenton Scenery
page.content: The general landscape in the Fenton, Kettlethorpe and Hardwick areas is flat. The land is split into fields with hedges and dykes. The village of Fenton has the main Lincoln to Gainsborough road passing through it, which cuts the village in half. There have been several new houses built in the last ten to fifteen years along this main road. Apart from the "Carpenters Arms" public house there are no amenities in the village. In contrast, Kettlethorpe village is situated at the end of a narrow lane which leads to The Hall, a large old house dating back to the 19th century. The parish church of St.Peter and St.Paul, the old vicarage and several other houses also date from this time. Most of the area is sparsley populated with isolated cottages and farm houses.
